intro: Ficus parietalis var. ovalis, commonly known as the wall fig or rock fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including India, Malaysia, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are typically oval in shape, giving it its specific variety name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocky surfaces or walls. This variety is popular as a houseplant due to its adaptability and ability to tolerate low light conditions.
